author: Microsoft
description:
Microfluidic cooling is part of Microsoft’s systems approach to advancing AI infrastructure - from chips to servers to datacenters, all the way to the cloud. This video shows how we’re able to deliver precision cooling with designs inspired by nature and optimized by AI. By etching microchannels directly onto the chip, coolant flows to the hottest regions of each CPU and GPU, enabling up to 3x better cooling performance than cold plates* and 65% reduction in maximum temperature rise of the silicon inside a GPU. Through innovations like this, we’re opening the door to new architectures that use less water and power, helping us build more sustainable, performant datacenters for the world’s most demanding AI workloads. 

*depending on depend on workloads and configurations involved

Read more in our blog: https://aka.ms/AApbc2e 
Explore the microfluidic cooling infographic: https://aka.ms/microfluidicsinfographic

Subscribe to Microsoft on YouTube here: https://aka.ms/SubscribeToYouTube
title: Introducing microfluidic cooling: a breakthrough in chip cooling technology
